intro: Psychotria guadalupensis subsp. tetrapyrena, commonly known as the Guadalupan Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Mexico, specifically the state of Guanajuato, where it grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red when mature. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
